website_summaries.verdict: Extremely comfortable mouthguard that includes a storage case.
pros: Design aims to allow the wearer to breathe more easily while working out
Rubber frame helps with shock absorption
Works especially well for martial arts participants
Offered in several color design options
cons: Could bite through the thin areas of this mouthguard

customer_reviews.title: All teeth
customer_reviews.text: Fought in a MMA fight and still have my teeth
customer_reviews.author: Anisha

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrating after two sparring sessions.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointing product. I wore this for basic sparring in Muay Thai twice and found myself with a mouthful of broken crumbs of blue plastic where the upper layer was disintegrating. I own a lot of other venom gear that is of a high standard and I really like, but this was a great disappointment and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't save your teeth. It breaks them.
customer_reviews.text: I chipped my teeth three times within the first two weeks of having this. I molded it to my teeth and followed the instructions. I was very sad about this.
customer_reviews.author: Bababarycia

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable as well
customer_reviews.text: This thing is rock solid. I actually don't use it for fighting but for working out. I tend to bite down so hard that I've cracked a few teeth so I figured I'd give this a shot. After the molding process I was simply stunned with how well it fit in my mouth. Comfortable as well. The extra rubber on the outside gave me something to really gnaw into, which I know is not the intended purposed but I'm simply blown away by the fit and quality of this. Can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: aj price

customer_reviews.title: Soft interior, but great mouthpiece
customer_reviews.text: Good mouthpiece. The interior (orange) is a bit soft, and I did manage to suck some of it onto my palate in the fitting process, but it trimmed off without an issue. I have used it for a season of rugby and it stays in without needing to keep my teeth clamped together. Communicating with it in is not phenomenal, but is still better than many other mouthpieces I have used. Note....if you leave it in your pocket and send it through the wash, it will need refitting...so don't be forgetful like me.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouth guard, easy to fit and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.text: I used this mouth guard longer than any other one I've bought. I had to cut a little excess material (the blue gel part) off after molding, but the fit is amazing. I can comfortably wear it during sparring and can even talk to my students to give them a little coaching. Speech isn't perfect, but it's better than most mouth guards. I only replaced it with something else because I was sick and figured putting the same mouth guard in my mouth over and over may contribute to me getting sick again after recovering. Fitting was easy, but it is very different than most other mouth guards so make sure to follow the instructions carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H Park

customer_reviews.title: Great mouth guard - easy to mold - Not too small
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to mold. I am a 6'-1" adult male and these are not too small for my mouth. Once you boil it, the rubber and the inner mold shapes to your mouth size and teeth. I was surprised how well the orange inner part formed around my teeth - They sink in deep and protect really well. My son had a cheaper guard from Revgear and he can barely move his lips with those and there's barely any forming around the teeth with his. I bought him one of these once I realized how good they were. Buy it - you won't regret it and you won't have problems with size if you boil them and follow directions.
customer_reviews.author: AM Texas

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but sacrifices durability
customer_reviews.text: It's a very comfortable mouth guard and fits very well. It does not last very long though. If you are only going to use it occasionally this would be good for you. It is flexible and doesn't have the rigid base which is probably why it is fragile and comfortable. The inner lining is easily bitten through and snaps and grinds off so be careful not to inhale it and choke. I recommend spending a bit more and getting the Venum predator instead if you want a longer lasting product, but if you only need a few uses this should be good.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lightweight simple mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems setting up the molding with the instructions provided and ended up with a nice clean dental impression into the mouthpiece. The mouthpiece feels pretty light and small in the mouth and for $15 I don't think you can go wrong. I've seen review stating that the mouthpiece is too small out of the box, it is small out of the box but once you boil it and bite down the rubber and the impression material will widen as you can see in the picture it's not as narrow as it was out of the box. So I have not used it for BJJ yet but it does seem pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as advertised. Some pluses some minuses. Being able to remold is a definite plus. I originally bit down too hard when molding and the gel like material thinned out and covered the roof of my mouth. I was able to reboil and force the molding gel back into its “original” position so i could start the molding process a second time. It’s not very easy to breath with it in my mouth and i find i have to breathe through my nose which can be difficult during heavy heavy exercise. The mouth guard fits nicely but will slide out if my mouth is open.
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy mouth guard although after 5 months I have bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy mouth guard although after 5 months I have bit through some of it but I play Roller Derby so midst hip checks and full body hits I definitely do some grinding on my mouth guards. I would guess that if you are able to avoid grinding too much then it would last longer. Another highlight would be if you are looking to be able to clearly speak without trying to hard then this one is smack dab in the middle of that need. You can talk but with a bit of effort to beclearly understood. I am definitely going to buy from Venum again!
customer_reviews.author: Nadia C.

customer_reviews.title: Mouthguard appears small, but still fit my big fat mouth.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this it appeared to be a child's mouth-guard. I read other reviews online and went through the "fitting" procedure. It actually fits real well, nice and snug if you follow the directions. Does not fall out, I actually have to pull it off of my teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Heindel

customer_reviews.title: Venum Challenger Mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: 1st pic : Only used 2 times 30 minutes each and it is coming apart. Have one more to try and see if its a fluke or... 2nd pic : The second one I had purchased got a month of use but that's only 3hrs a week maybe Absolute junk
customer_reviews.author: fish-n-fool

customer_reviews.title: Good solid mouth guard, great mold to fit.
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty easy to mold. Took me just a few minutes to get them the way I wanted, and it created a fantastic seal. I've used these for a couple of sparring sessions already. Had no difficulty breathing, and they fit well. I haven't gotten hit too hard while wearing these, but I don't feel any discomfort and they feel very absorbing when I bite down. Gives me the confidence to know that at least the mouth guards will protect me if I make a terrible mistake and don't protect myself.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: Jiu Jitsu and Invisalign
customer_reviews.text: Great mouthguard. I replace mine once every few months to keep it fresh. I use it for jits and MMA/muay thai sparring. The one time I forgot to wear it I hit my tooth and shifted it enough to need Invisalign. I was worried about making the molds with my retainers in, but I do the boil and bite on the last day of a set before changing to my next just in case the heat would damage them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it! But maybe upgrade if you take hard hits to the jaw
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouthguard. Feels comfortable, cushy; has detailed instructions on how to mold to your teeth and is not too big. Rated 4 instead of 5 because I cracked the lower left hand corner from, I presume, how hard I was biting down. Cracked the white and the harder black plastic. For my purposes, it's still fine for now. Edit: I cracked it after less than a month of use 3x per week
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good mouthguard for light sparring. Very comfortable, however probably not your best bet for high/heavy impact. It's a little flimsy. Don't get me wrong, I like the mouthguard very much, I just wouldn't use it for full contact fighting. Oh and don't get freaked out when molding...the gel goops out over the edges and makes it look like you ruined/melted your mouthguard. The instructions tell you just to trim the excess. Nice mouthguard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This mouthguard is great! Fits great, easy to mold and great protection in sparring! Great price for a great product! Venum makes awesome fight gear!! I used the Ringside fang one and it would show imprint of teeth but the second I put my teeth into the Venum one I felt them sink in and form. The Ringside fell when you opened your mouth and this stays in place and is comfortable! Recommended for any looking for a great priced and great, durable product!
customer_reviews.author: KoreanGrenadeMMA

customer_reviews.title: Great for Grappling
customer_reviews.text: I read somewhere that these are the best mouth guards for the money and its true. I'm on my second one and it's super comfortable for grappling. Do not leave it in a hot car in the south though. It gets hot enough to melt the gel a little. Do it too many times and it wont fit anymore. Easily my favorite mouth guard of the half dozen or so boil and bite mouth guards I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Skeby

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: Great mouth guard. My 1st mouth guard was this one and then I lost it, decided to buy the Predator instead of another one of these. Predator was okay, but this one is a lot more comfortable. It sits right on my teeth, soft and cosy. So after sometime of using the predator, I went back to this one and it's as comfortable as I remembered it.
customer_reviews.author: Mila Motik

customer_reviews.title: Great For Grappling
customer_reviews.text: Use this for Brazilian Jiu jitsu. I have bought 4 so far because they are extremely comfortable. However, I do end up buying through these after about 4 to 5 months of use. Would be nice if they lasted a bit longer but I don't mind to keep buying them because they are comfortable. Best dental plan for contact sports is a mouth guard
customer_reviews.author: warren hooper

customer_reviews.title: other than that they fit terrible. i bought 2 just in case i screwed ...
customer_reviews.text: only reason i give it 2 stars is the color scheme. other than that they fit terrible. i bought 2 just in case i screwed one up but both times they came out terrible. i followed the instructions to the "T" and was disappointed both times. you might as well just go to your dentist to get one or order one from The Mouthpiece Guy online. A little pricey but definitely worth it if he customizes for the pros. so all in all, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product; Fits perfectly...highly recommend and I'm a "big-mouthed" guy.
customer_reviews.text: Having read several of the negative reviews, I bought 2 different mouth guards. More than one of the reviews suggests that this model is too small. I am a larger athlete and surmise that anyone who thinks this is too small may not have properly heated / installed the mouth guard properly. This product is outstanding. It fits like a glove and I have uneven teeth. Very happy with the fit and especially the carrying case. Follow the fitting instructions to the letter.
customer_reviews.author: Denver

customer_reviews.title: Strong and thin, fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Just like others posted it is one of the very few mouthguards that will fit you if your jaws and teeth are on the smaller side! I have used many others of this kind but they are either too bulky to talk or even close your mouth when you have it or the rows are too wide. This one is very compact and thin. I have used it for about half a year before plastic started falling apart, but I also have a terrible habit of chewing on it, so it might last you longer!
customer_reviews.author: Saintasia

customer_reviews.title: My husband is 6"4', 220 lbs and uses this ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6"4', 220 lbs and uses this mouth guard for brazilian jiu jitsu. Some reviews say its small but that is nonsense. Once you go through the fitting (warm water used to mold it) it will be just right.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice in Mouthguards!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Venum Challenger Mouthguard after having multiple people accidently bumping my jaw and teeth with their knees, elbows, and other bodily appendages in Brazilian Jiu-JItsu roll matches. The Venum Challenger Mouthguard fits snugly onto my teeth during hard rolls on that mats with my partners, preventing any unnecessary bumps and damages to them. I've had this product for at least a year and haven't had a need to complain about it whatsoever. I would highly recommend the Venum Challenger to anybody looking for top-quality dental protection from any rough and tumble activities.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R. Jadloski

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on us
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our oldest to use in Muay Thai. They fell apart by the second use also did not mold great. Our oldest has played football and other sports...he's used different mouth guards plenty of times. This did not work as advertised. We may have just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Shan^2

customer_reviews.title: Quality decrease?
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my son. The dental molding started to come loose from the outside structure after 2 months. I have the same mouthpiece and it’s lasted years. My assumption is cheaper materials to decrease cost and increase profit, like most companies.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: Not for adults... Or is it?
customer_reviews.text: The product claims to be for 11+ but the mouth piece is tiny and the sheet of paper that came with it says for 10 and under... What the heck? There is also no product support so - rip refund. Edit: After buying different mouth guards and finally just attempting to mold this one instead of leaving it on the shelf, I found that it is the right size after all. It expands in the hot water. Changed review star to 4 cus it fits nice. Sorry for the previously hasty review.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouthguard ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best Mouthguard I have ever used! it is so comfortable, I even forget I'm wearing it. It is so perfect, I can talk and breath easily. It provides great protection for sparring as well. I would highly recommend this mouthguard, it is much more comfortable than Shock Doctor ones, and is just as good in quality.
customer_reviews.author: CEN

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow I don't know why I didn't go with this mouth guard sooner! Ive originally been using a Everlast guard (two so far) you get from a Big 5 store but always have had a problem with the outside lip of the Everlast get really rough after molding. Each time I get hit with or without head gear I would get cut from it. Got a second one thinking it would be different but the same thing happened. Just had my first fight and threw the Venum guard in it was very smooth on the outside edge, no cuts. Get this product
customer_reviews.author: Stormnorman

customer_reviews.title: Good Boil & Bite
customer_reviews.text: Good standard boil & bite mouthguard. Remember: try to get it right on your first try. The waxy stuff inside the mouthguard will soften for you to bite into. If you mess up, you will have to do it again and it might not be perfect fitting. Do it in front of a mirror so you know its centered. Tldr: it works as intended, good entry level mouthguard for mma/boxing. Protect your teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin C

customer_reviews.title: Form fitting and plenty of cushion!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent upgrade from the Everlast mouthguard you'll find at big sporting goods stores, that offered only a very shallow mold and left my gums bloody from banging around. I often couldn't breathe or speak through it. The Venum, by contrast is: not too bulky; molds perfectly around every tooth if you follow the directions; very soft and feels like there's a lot of cushion surrounding each tooth. Can't speak to durability because I hope to never push it to its absolute limits...
customer_reviews.author: E. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fit
customer_reviews.text: Basic mouth guard easy to follow directions are the same for every mouth guard. Very comfortable fit. This is actually my third. One for me one for my son and a replacement for my son as his bite changed. All three are great.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, breathability.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, mouth guard is rather soft and very easy to breathe out of. It got stuck to my case when it was in my car which flattened out one of the ridges. Had to cut it off. Don't leave in hot environment, keep in room temperature conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Walters

customer_reviews.title: Boil and bite. Slightly bulky for my mouth.
customer_reviews.text: Looked too small at first, but after following the fitting procedure as directed, they were a bit too far from my teeth even though I held them up against my grill for longer than required, while sucking. Tried fitting them again, but same issue. It still guards my teeth, but feels a little bulky in my mouth compared to a general mouth guard.
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Worked as intended
customer_reviews.text: Great mouthguard. Comes with instructions on how to fit it properly (you're gonna have to boil it, fit it in your mouth, then freeze it for 10 minutes) follow the instructions exactly and these will work great and last forever. I spar consistently and these are the most comfortable to have while sparring I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Good for low impact sports, but fit feels too small
customer_reviews.text: I've read that this particular Venum version is not rated for any activity above Basketball/Football/Lacrosse, so it is not really intended for fight sports (note: I'm using this for boxing sparring sessions). Additionally, even after molding this guard did not stretch enough to fit towards the molars. It left me feeling uncomfortable with the fit. It seems to be a fine guard, but not as versatile as the description makes it out to be.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Used for a few months
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far. Not sure what else to write, it molded easy and it stays in place
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and lightweight mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Venum Challenger Mouthguard. The instructions were easy to follow to make the mold. It fits comfortably and is very lightweight. I comes with a basic plastic case that helps me keep up with it. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Once again, amazing delivery.
customer_reviews.text: MMAwearhouse...my favorite supplier on Amazon. Amazing delivery....always arrives ahead of schedule. The product itself was supplied as advertised. Fitted them yesterday (the whole hot water/cold water thing)...one of the most comfortable mouth guards I have had. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Luqman Ali Mooraj

customer_reviews.title: Cost Effective, Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: About as good as a basic Bad Boy mouthguard. I wear this mouthguard during BJJ/kickboxing classes and it does the job. Wish it felt a bit thicker though. Easy to mold and I didn’t need to trim it at all. I would recommend this mouthguard to people who train casually and are just starting out. Idk if a pro martial artist would use it.
customer_reviews.author: Arden

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good for kids or people with weak bite-force.
customer_reviews.text: I bit straight through the front of this the very first time I used it, excluding the fitting process. It was comfortable when it was first fitted, but it didn't retain it's form for long and never really suctioned close enough to my teeth. Also, it needs to be WAY thicker in the back. Now, I have slightly larger front teeth, but still, there is nowhere near enough material in the back to bite down on. Now, I use it for powerlifting, which may be the "wrong application" but in my mind it should still function properly, but it did not.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Witzke

customer_reviews.title: Seems perfect to me
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of experience with mouth guards, but I bought this to use at my roller derby training camp practices. It did look small in the case, but once you boil it and mold it it fits fine. I am a 24 year old female and it fit my mouth perfectly. It's easy and has clear instructions. I like that is came with a case. The color is also super cute!
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: Works great for BJJ.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and it works great. Protects my teeth and doesn’t make it harder to breath while rolling. Forming was pretty easy and just had to trim a little excessive away for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Rob P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mouth guard! The closest to a custom mouth guard for a bite and boil, plus inexpensive. I got this a week before my first Muay Thai fight. It worked great in the fight!
customer_reviews.author: RYAN

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!! I bought this mouthguard 1 month ago black/blue. The blue part is peeling away from the black part and my child nearly choked on a fairly large piece. I do NOT recommend this product to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Easy configuration and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use this during martial arts free sparring. The initial fitting process is simple and well-documented. There's an included case for the mouthguard which is very convenient. The case could be better with a loop to attach it to a gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and good investment
customer_reviews.text: Pretty comfortable mouth piece. It’s not super heavy duty. But good for grappling. It’s not as intrusive as heavier mouth guards so the trade off is the protection. All in all not a bad product
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth piece ever
customer_reviews.text: Easiest mouth guard to breath in as well as a very comfortable fit. If any drawback I would say don’t bite as hard as u can when forming to ur mouth if u do still works great!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great mouthguard for BJJ
customer_reviews.text: Great mouthguard for Brazilian Jiu-jitsu. I tried the cheap Redline one (too bulky) and the Shock Doctor Superfit (didn't feel like enough cushion and felt hard against my lower teeth). This one fits and feels great. I'm a girl but I don't consider my mouth to be small. It does expand a bit when you boil it. Don't bite down too hard when the directions say 'firmly'. Follow the instructions and you'll be good.
customer_reviews.author: AIria

customer_reviews.title: Good for a child but not for adults
customer_reviews.text: Good for a child but not for adults. It's true what people say that it does stretch out but not that much. On an adult mouth it leaves the last 3 teeth unprotected but gets the job done for now since I'm just sparring with it.
customer_reviews.author: Azavelli

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Protects well enough light sparring. I may not have fitted the mouthpiece correctly, but it does feel a bit big. If I bite down on it for too long, my jaw feels a bit stiff. I still use it, just avoid biting down on it too hard during sparring sessions.
customer_reviews.author: David Dee

customer_reviews.title: The best mouthguard in the market
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best mouthguard I've ever had. From the packaging, to the molding, all of it is just super high quality. I've used Shock Doctor's before, and they sent me Youth Sizes when I specifically ordered Adult, lol. This one came super fast, was only $8 in the purple color, and the molding process was actually fantastic — wasn't rough or hurtful, like other mouthguards, this was actually pretty smooth and the gel quality is great. Love the casing, and hope this lasts long!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Costa

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely buy these again if necessary! They were very easy to mold to my mouth, creating a custom product I would have thought was out of my price range
customer_reviews.author: allthatglitters

customer_reviews.title: One of the nicest mouthguards I've used in a while ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the nicest mouthguards I've used in a while. Most other mouthguards feel very bulky in my mouth. This one takes the hits, protects my teeth, while still being able to breath correctly. I can even speak with it in.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to mold perfect
customer_reviews.text: A pain to get molded properly. I'd recommend spending a little more for a custom piece. I tried multiple times and did everything right and could not get a good snug fit near the back of my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Drake B.

customer_reviews.title: Fits me great, and very protective
customer_reviews.text: Really like mine. I reshaped mine a few times to get the fit just how I wanted, but that’s not the fault of the guard. It stays on my teeth well, I can talk and drink comfortably with it on. It feels very protective and been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: ilajna

customer_reviews.title: This is a great mouthguard! It feels very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouthguard! It feels very sturdy, it was easy to fit (follow directions to a T) I haven't been punched in the face yet but I am sure that mouthguard will do its job it just feels great! When I first got it and saw it in the package I thought they accidentally sent me the kid size, but it after boiling it expands.
customer_reviews.author: loveGod

customer_reviews.title: I've been doing mma for a while and love this mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing mma for a while and love this mouthguard. Most people say it's small, but even at 6'2" I think it fits well. A mouthguard shouldn't take up a lot of space between your top and bottom teeth. It actually makes it easier to mess up your jaw from straight punches to the chin that way.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Buy this. Absolutely perfect for BJJ.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely game changing. Sticks to my crooked teeth perfectly. Incredible form and function. And you can breathe and drink with it in!
customer_reviews.author: Turd Ferguson (It's a funny name)

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality product
customer_reviews.text: Used this for heavy leg days. Sure beats grinding your teeth when lifting heavy! Good product and comfortable! Was easy to mold
customer_reviews.author: NeedRangeTime

customer_reviews.title: Just what he needed
customer_reviews.text: Son loves the best. He plays rugby and you can form this one to fit perfectly. Purchased different mouth guards, but this one is beefy and sold. Did buy more for spares, or if misplaced, which has happened. If you like it, buy an extra one, because you can't play or want your son to play sports without mouth guard.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Comfortable, and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've been practicing boxing for about 5-6 months now with some good friends of mine. Now that I've gotten down the fundamentals, we were finally starting to get more into actual sparring. I was nervous at first because I wasn't used to getting hit, but wearing this mouthguard really helped boost my confidence! This mouth guard is seamless! It's comfortable, feels good, allows you to breathe without overcrowding your mouth -- pretty much everything I needed in a mouth guard. Extremely satisfied with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nam T.

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time getting a very good fit. I tried twice and the second attempt appears to adhered to the roof of my mouth for the most part but comes off easier than I’d liked. The first time around it was twisted and wouldn’t fit at all. I’ll see how it hold up in the competition, but I believe I’m gonna have to find a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Turner

customer_reviews.title: Can be remolded several times.
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble getting mine set right (biting too hard?) but was able to remold it several times. Just boil it and push the "wax" back in and retry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: he's getting pretty pissed about having to wear it during class
customer_reviews.text: So far, son's teeth are still in place. Will post if anything changes. Though honestly, he's getting pretty pissed about having to wear it during class, to which I say you can't be too carefully; dental coverage only covers annual cleaning so you know.
customer_reviews.author: dbpsyfi

customer_reviews.title: Great for BJJ
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I use it in BJJ when I’m rolling because I’ll occasionally get elbowed in the mouth. Protects very well! I’m not sure how good it would be for Muay Thai but it’s great for Jiu Jitsu for those occasional accidental blows to the face.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: dont judge a book by its cover after molding fit snug at first but then it fit perfect after some use
customer_reviews.text: it does look small almost makes you think its not for adults but for females and or kids. however, dont judge a book by its cover after molding fit snug at first but then it fit perfect after some use. i can breathe better than the one i was using from everlast. i can breathe better,talk better, and feels great doesnt irritate sides of my mouth. I purchased another one in white highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Second Time Buying It!
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed up my first Venum but I love this mouth guard so much I bought another. It's sturdy enough to prevent TMJ when I'm on my heaviest squat and deadlift sets but spongy enough to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MickIX

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouthpiece (pretty thick rubber though)
customer_reviews.text: Great Mouthpiece (pretty thick rubber though, which definitely distorts your mouth more than usual when wearing it).
customer_reviews.author: VF

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bit through this after 5 times I wore it. The molding for your back molars is not very strong. I ordered a new one and after a couple sparring sessions it's also torn up. Will be going with a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Zohar

customer_reviews.title: Knee to the chin
customer_reviews.text: Got kneed in the chin the other day while rolling and I barely felt it because let's face it...I'm a tough guy but I'm also a handsome guy and I need all of my teeth. This will help you keep all the teeth you already had.
customer_reviews.author: Apollothewriter

customer_reviews.title: Teeny tiny little mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: This mouthguard looks like it would fit a toddler, I can't imagine how it could possibly get big enough for an adult even after boiling it, I'm contemplating returning 🤔
customer_reviews.author: Scott Walters

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, easily molded and comfortable for my two ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, easily molded and comfortable for my two little hockey players. The problem is that the black stuff on the inside is considerably softer than the colored rubber on the outside. After only a few weeks the black interior (which is the part that is molded) began to disintegrate. So the kids would be spitting black rubber bits out (or worse swallow them). And once the black interior is gone, nothing is really molded. I've gone back to the under armour option which is more durable.
customer_reviews.author: John GDC

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth guard out there
customer_reviews.text: I always come back to this brand. Easy to mold, last forever, and priced well. I've tried other brands and always come back to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Teeth saver
customer_reviews.text: I was literally punched in the face by former ufc fighters Keith Jardine and Kyle Kingsbury while wearing this. My nose bled my eye blacked but I still have all my teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great mouth guard not much else to
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one i order, i bought same one a year ago and it is still holding up well and fits well after a year(3 times a week) of training, only reason i bought a second one is to act as backup. Great mouth guard not much else to say
customer_reviews.author: Roman.K

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy to mold.
customer_reviews.text: Great safety product. It's easy to mold and doesn't take long. This one is great quality and lasts a while.
customer_reviews.author: morgan

customer_reviews.title: worked great, fit great
customer_reviews.text: FIT GREAT, STILL HAVE ALL MY TEETH & DIDN'T BITE MY TOUNGE. I WOULD BUY AGAIN & RECOMMEND TO ANY FRIENDS
customer_reviews.author: Stan R. Keith Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for lifting weights.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mouthpiece for lifting weights. I bought it because I chipped my bottom tooth lifting weights. I now use this mouthpiece and it’s amazing! I can lift heavy weights and not be worried that I’m going to crush my teeth. Be lifting for 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: First Blood

customer_reviews.title: Protect your mouth!
customer_reviews.text: Mouth guards are never comfortable, but as far as mouth guards go, this one felt good. Easy to mold (boil and bite method), and cleans up easily. Stays in place, even when bouncing around. I have yet to take a heavy hit to the jaw with it in, but I trust that when I do, it'll keep my teeth and tongue in place.
customer_reviews.author: SA7

customer_reviews.title: Fits great for me
customer_reviews.text: Does appear small, however once it's boiled you shape it to fit your mouth. Fits great for me, seems like it will give you great protection with its two layers and fits snug. Not bulky at all.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lauria

customer_reviews.title: Help for the non-fighter
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fighter, I am a 44yo woman who grinds her teeth at night when stressed out. I bit through the Walgreens mouth guard in my sleep. This is well made, easy to mold ( read the other reviews ) and I wake up and it does not have teeth marks on the outside! I cant bite through it. I work in Medicine and now that this is a much easier and cheaper solution then going to the dentist and having one made for a lot more $$$$.
customer_reviews.author: NunyaBiz

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for smaller mouths.
customer_reviews.text: Quick to fit. But it is really tight and squeezes inward on my upper teeth. I find myself constantly popping off my teeth while wearing. Did not see any size options.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mouth guard.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way this one feels. Unlike others like it, this one is quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like others stated
customer_reviews.text: Like others stated, if you have a small mouth you're in trouble. The mouthguard constantly was hitting my gag reflex. I tried re-molding it a few times and it didn't help. It felt like it was made out of decent materials so i give it two stars, but i don't think the fit is for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alan W Yalch

customer_reviews.title: Way too small, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Extremely small fit. The adult size fits my 12 year old. Way too small for average adult male. We kept the adult size and it fit my 12 year old. He wore it to four ju jitsu classes and the inner part is falling apart. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable and fits good if you follow the molding process right! Easy to breath when wearing it as well
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Raghu

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a bit guard for powerlifting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a bite guard for powerlifting, as I was clenching my teeth on heavy weights. This worked great to protect my teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Martin B

customer_reviews.title: it fits perfect. took a few boils to get it exactly ...
customer_reviews.text: it looks very small. i thought it wouldn't fit my mouth, and im not a huge guy. however, it fits perfect. took a few boils to get it exactly to my teeth. im wary of only giving a 4 because it is a good product but im not used to mouth guards. i dont feel like i could take an elbow to the teeth with this (basketball). given the chances of a hard elbow in basketball i still think it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Zhi C. Yee

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, and unbeatable at the price point.
customer_reviews.text: The fit process for this was really easy, and equally as snug as a custom mouthguard I had made perviously. It's a little bulkier than a custom mouthguard, but for the price and convenience, this is unquestionably the best mouthguard I've tried. Once it's in, it fits very securely, and stays put unless I make it a point to take it off. I can also talk pretty well while wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M Ries

customer_reviews.title: Great and safe
customer_reviews.text: I tried many different mouthguards, this si the best by far. Comfortable amd safe for either jou jitsu or kickboxing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable mouthpiece, but...
customer_reviews.text: My son loved the fit of this mouthpiece and after 9 years of football he's tried everything. The problem is, this one was for rugby and he forgot it in his shorts pocket. One wash and dry and it was ruined. The red filling turned to goo and was full of lint and stuck to the pocket lining. I bought him a second one, and a few weeks later it met the same fate.
customer_reviews.author: KickersMom505

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend approves!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boyfriend for his kickboxing classes and he loves it! No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Carlie

customer_reviews.title: pretty sure its doin it's job
customer_reviews.text: Spar with this. Took a few mean right hooks and crosses to the face. No dental work required yet. So, pretty sure its doin it's job. Matches my schools colors so, even better
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: It's for kids, NOT adults.
customer_reviews.text: I was laboring under the misapprehension it was for adults. I wasted a ton of money with the expedited shipping. I'll get some use out of it. (just needed it so I don't grit my teeth). but advertise that more prominently.
customer_reviews.author: lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great for bjj
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend for jiu jitsu and he loves it. Says he can talk with it in and it’s molded perfect to his teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Vuoti

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I've had several mouthguards by different manufacturers and so far this is is the best. I was able to get it fitted by myself and have it ready to use within a few hours. The instructions were simple. The mouthguard was soft to touch but protective when worn. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Spigner

customer_reviews.title: Iff safe ur teef!
customer_reviews.text: Eh liff diff moufgarb a wot! Iff sooba eathy ta mahk fitf ur mouf. Iff comfabul too!
customer_reviews.author: C.K.

product_meta.title: Venum Challenger Mouthguard
feature_bullets: Ne XT fit gel frame for a better adjustment and comfort
High Density rubber frame for a better shock management
